Boston.com
10

Brown questions Markey's residency in Massachusetts

Scott Brown took on a possible opponent in a race to succeed John Kerry, questioning whether Rep. Edward Markey lives in the state. (Globe, 12:57 p.m.)
  • Pictures Possible candidates to succeed Kerry

Despite fiscal deal, taxes to rise for most

While the tax package Congress passed will protect 99 percent of Americans from an income tax increase, most will still end up paying more federal taxes. (AP, 1:12 p.m.)
  • House approves fiscal deal | What's included, left out
  • How House members voted | US stocks surge
  • Obama lauds House vote | Text of Obama's remarks
  • House GOP is blasted for scrapping Sandy aid vote

Local notables on their 2013 resolutions

We asked well-known figures around Boston to share their resolutions. From nail-biting to complaining too much, see what they're resolving to fix in 2013.
  • What local notables should resolve to do in 2013
  • share What's your 2013 New Year's resolution?

Zipcar to be sold for nearly $500 million

Zipcar Inc., the Cambridge-based vehicle sharing service that rents cars by the hour, is being purchased by the Avis Budget Group for $491.2 million. (Globe, 9:28 a.m.)
  • Analysis of the Zipcar sale  |  History of Zipcar

Arraignment in first 2013 Boston murder

Brian MacDonald, 24, of Allston is claiming self-defense in the stabbing death of Anthony Spaulding, 21, of Harwich, during a party Tuesday. (Globe, 12:04 p.m.)

to join State House display

Placing homeless in motels to end

The Mass. government plans to eliminate an emergency shelter program that places about 1,700 homeless families in motels and hotels paid by taxpayers.

Time is running out in Washington for the country to avoid the fiscal cliff. If that happens, 8 or 9 percent budget cuts would hit the majority of the federal government and could throw the country back into a recession. So what do you do?
